instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message:
I have an 820-00239, the client tried to install a new screen with himself,
i believe he didn't disconnect the battery before the installation, 
Now there is no image or backlight on screen, I tried 2 screens
no image on external
the fan spin and CPU get hot
USB c 20v/0.8a
battery charge normally 
I think the board start 
already replaced u8520 and U8500

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message: usb c activity normal, i get 20v and start from 0.2a to 0.8a, that mean the board boot. if the battery connected it go to 2.5a

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message:
Please confirm USB activity for sure first.
Use USB mouse, or pendrive with Link LED.

Disconnect internal LCD, when test external video.

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message: OKAY, no light on the usb pendriver led, fan spinning and nothing on external screen

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message:
If no USB activity, no reason for video search.
Your board doesn'r really boot, just stays on; is not the same thing.

CPU could got damaged in some way...

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message: This kind of CPU is replaceable like the GPU of 2011 model ?

threads.title: 820-00239, no image on screen
threads.message:
Pufff, is total different thing.
I'm sure you can find videos on Internet, but I don't recommend to bother with it.
